title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 12 September 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:20 <Denis> has quit  
00:28 <jvdrean> has quit  
01:18 <polx> has quit  
01:22 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
01:42 <polx> has quit  
02:57 <DSpair\_AFK> has quit  
03:00 <DSpair\_AFK> has joined #xwiki  
03:12 <iamcorbin> has joined #xwiki  
03:56 <tekzilla> has quit  
03:58 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
05:00 <eshan> has joined #xwiki  
05:26 <CIA-121> has quit  
06:02 <coud> has joined #xwiki  
06:08 <coud> has quit  
06:38 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:38 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
07:40 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:59 <mflorea> has quit  
08:23 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:29 <vmassol> has quit  
09:01 <iamcorbin> has quit  
09:19 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
09:32 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:08 <vmassol> guys I think the dates on http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Roadmap are obsolete  
10:10 <vmassol> hmm I think I forgot to send a vote email to postpone the final date by one week  
10:10 <+mflorea> vmassol, jvdrean: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/fdda6f134b9b1d5532e2b7f7c3179f5d1e861162 introduced a regression: I have to restart the server in order for the hidden pref to take effect  
10:11 <vmassol> I'm in a meeting now, I'll let jvdrean handle this  
10:11 <+mflorea> it's not enough to set the instantiation per-lookup if a singleton component (query manager?) gets the filter only once  
10:12 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
10:12 <vmassol> jvdrean: shouldn't you close http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7926 ?  
10:13 <+jvdrean> vmassol: I don't think so, for the moment application spaces still appear in the list of spaces  
10:13 <+jvdrean> (looking at the regression)  
10:14 <vmassol> jvdrean: ok we need to talk about this  
10:14 <+jvdrean> vmassol: I can't reproduce  
10:14 <+mflorea> jvdrean, wait a sec, it might have to do with the way I'm using the query manager  
10:19 <sburjan> has quit  
10:20 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:24 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:30 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:35 <+mflorea> jvdrean: found the issue, I had the hidden document filter injected in my singleton component. Would be good to add a warning to the release notes saying that starting with 4.2M3 you need to dynamically lookup the hidden document filter in singleton components.  
10:38 <+jvdrean> mflorea: indeed  
11:00 <+Enygma`> jvdrean: one alternative to componentManager.getInstance(QueryFilter.class, "hidden") would be to keep the declarative @Inject section, but use Provider<QueryFilter> filterProvider; instead of QueryFilter filter;  
11:01 <+Enygma`> then you just use filterProvider.get();  
11:01 <+Enygma`> this way you avoid working with/depending on the component manager  
11:02 <+Enygma`> vmassol: which of the 2 options should we advertise as the best practice? If I remember correctly, it should be the Provider way, right?  
11:02 <vmassol> otp  
11:03 <vmassol> provider is to be used when you need to get the instance lazily  
11:04 <+Enygma`> and if the component changes instantiation method in the meanwhile from PER\_LOOKUP to SINGLETON, the Provider will return the singleton, right?  
11:06 <vmassol> you can check GenericProvider implementation to see the algo  
11:07 <vmassol> one very important thing to remember is that ATM a runtimeexcption is thrown if not found so caller need to know this  
11:08 <+Enygma`> it seems to use componentManager.getInstance(...) internally, so this means that the instantiation method will be taken into account  
11:08 <+jvdrean> yes, it should do the same as my previous example but in a more elegant way  
11:08 <+jvdrean> I'm updating the RN  
11:42 <vmassol> guys when can we release M3 now? Can it be done today?  
11:43 <vmassol> we have an issue in that RC1 is supposed to be release next Monday (17th)...  
11:43 <Denis1> In the Container module, why the Session interface is empty ? should not this interface provide abstraction of a session ?  
11:43 <vmassol> Denis1: yes, it's just not implemented yet  
11:43 <+mflorea> I just commited a fix on platform for wysiwyg-tests. There is some flickering on selenium-tests. I think we can start the release after the current build is done  
11:44 <Denis1> vmassol: any alternative to keep a object between requests ?  
11:45 <vmassol> should we postpone RC1 to Wednesday 19th? And do final on 24th  
11:45 <+Enygma`> mflorea: are you sure that is flickering?  
11:45 <+Enygma`> it is failing quite consistently  
11:45 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
11:45 <vmassol> Denis1: right now you'd need to use the servlet context  
11:46 <vmassol> Denis: either using the XWikiContext.getEngineContext or using ServletContext directly, ie not going through container. The good alternative is to implement Container Session  
11:46 <vmassol> mflorea: should we postpone RC1 to Wednesday 19th? And do final on 24th?  
11:46 <vmassol> Enygma`: ?  
11:46 <+mflorea> Enygma`: it doesn't fail locally and I think I've seen this test failing before. I'll double check anyway  
11:47 <+Enygma`> vmassol: do you know what the job xwiki-platform-core-site-job is supposed to do?  
11:47 <vmassol> Enygma`: generate the maven site I believe  
11:47 <vmassol> (jenkins job right?)  
11:48 <+mflorea> vmassol: +1, doing the RC on Monday is a bit short  
11:48 <vmassol> ok sending vote  
11:48 <+Enygma`> if we do the release today, I think it would be OK to keep RC1 for Monday  
11:48 <+Enygma`> but that`s just my oppinion  
11:48 <vmassol> Enygma`: not much time to test  
11:49 <+mflorea> Enygma`: it fails because it doesn't have enough PermGem. We need to check why.  
11:49 <vmassol> mflorea: do you still have stuff to commit?  
11:49 <+Enygma`> yes, but we also have the RC1-Final window to fix  
11:49 <vmassol> (known stuff)  
11:49 <+mflorea> vmassol: for M3?  
11:49 <vmassol> Enygma`: yes but it's better to fix for RC1 than for fginal  
11:49 <vmassol> final  
11:49 <vmassol> final is supposed to be just a rename of RC  
11:49 <vmassol> theoretically we're not supposed to make any change  
11:49 <+Enygma`> except bugfixes  
11:49 <vmassol> since otherwise it theoretically means a RC2  
11:49 <vmassol> not even bugfixe  
11:50 <vmassol> bugfixes  
11:50 <vmassol> but we do that from time to time but it's still not good  
11:50 <vmassol> so if we have known bugfixes to do  
11:50 <vmassol> we shoudl do them for RC1  
11:50 <vmassol> mflorea: for 4.2  
11:50 <+Denis> vmassol: not really a good option IMO, since it does not follow the session lifecycle and it will require a "session" like isolation. Implementing Session would be nice, but postpone availability too much. Disappointed that the basic session interface was not implemented upfront :(  
11:51 <vmassol> Denis: there has been no need so far...  
11:51 <+Enygma`> mflorea: the PermGen remark was about the selenium tests or about xwiki-platform-core-site-job ?  
11:51 <vmassol> but I know there's a need ofc, it just needs to be implemented  
11:52 <+mflorea> I would like to work on two thinks (1) display invalid extensions differently (some red marker) and (2) make the upgrade plan live (i.e. update the upgrade plan log which it is build). But I'm not sure how much time I will have because I need to work on portlet integration too  
11:52 <+mflorea> Enygma`: site job  
11:52 <vmassol> is the portlet integration work criticial in term of deadlines?  
11:52 <vmassol> (or could the deadline be pushed so that you focus on ths first?)  
11:53 <+mflorea> the deadline is mid September  
11:53 <vmassol> hard deadline? :)  
11:53 <+mflorea> I could finish this week, which leave me 2-3 days next week for EM  
11:54 <+mflorea> I think so, need to check with Thomas and Guillaume  
11:54 <vmassol> ok would be good if you could get 3-4 days of free time to finish 4.2  
11:55 <+Denis> vmassol: no, I will cast to servletSession  
11:55 <+Denis> not matter of deadline really, I just do not want to depends on 4.2  
11:56 <vmassol> Denis: sorry, was talking to marius atually ;)  
11:57 <+Denis> vmassol: read too fast  
11:57 <+Enygma`> ie8 and ie9 tests are disabled. Is that normal? Can we do the release without them?  
11:58 <+sburjan> Enygma`: the agents were lost during an uprade of the machine. I will have to re-install them with Alex  
11:58 <+mflorea> Enygma`: yes, they were suppose to run on windows agents, which were removed. We kept the jobs for future, in case we add the agents back. You an ignore them  
11:58 <+Enygma`> right  
11:59 <+sburjan> Enygma`: check your skype :)  
12:00 <+Enygma`> ok, so once the current builds are done, I will go ahead with the release process and copy the sources  
12:01 <+Enygma`> sburjan: sorry, new skype's notfications fault :)  
12:02 <Enygma`> has quit  
12:02 <Enygma`1> has joined #xwiki  
12:07 <+mflorea> Enygma`: all selenium tests passed this time  
12:07 <+mflorea> I think we can assume it's a flicker (needs to be fix at some point)  
12:09 <Enygma`1> cool  
12:10 <Enygma`1> I remember excluding maven-agent3 or vmaven-agent5 from the selenium test before starting it, but I no longer see that in the configuration  
12:10 <Enygma`1> mflorea: did you clean it?  
12:10 <Enygma`1> is now known as <Enygma`>  
12:11 <+mflorea> maybe, I did play with that config on a couple of jobs  
12:11 <+mflorea> not in the last few hours though  
12:12 <Enygma`> wierd... anyway, tests pass, that`s good  
12:13 <Enygma`> waiting for the rest of the build...  
12:18 <mflorea> has quit  
12:44 <+sburjan> vmassol: re Postponing 4.2. I will have only 2 days for testing the RC1. 20 and 21. Because 22 and  23 are in weekend. I won't have the time for a full manual test.  
12:46 <+sburjan> I guess postponing for another day is out of the question, right ?  
12:54 <vmassol> sburjan: start now :)  
12:54 <+sburjan> I'm busy with 4.1.4 ATM  
12:55 <vmassol> hmm  
12:55 <vmassol> not the priority IMO  
12:55 <vmassol> silvia said she could help with 4.1.4  
12:55 <vmassol> maybe you can talk to her? (I've had a discussion with her this morning)  
12:55 <+sburjan> and she is. she is performing the full manual test and I am checking if the fixedFor 4.1.4 issues are truly fixed. OFC, the ones I can test  
12:56 <+sburjan> i have talked with her. this is her proposal I'm writing here  
12:56 <vmassol> we're already late, we can't postpone more  
12:56 <+sburjan> ok  
12:58 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
13:11 <Enygma`> so core-site-job is still failing with PermGen issues...  
13:11 <Enygma`> I still don`t understand what it does and if it is vital for the release or not  
13:11 <vmassol> Enygma`: don't bother with this job  
13:11 <Enygma`> ok then  
13:11 <vmassol> absolutely not vital  
13:11 <Enygma`> thanks  
13:12 <vmassol> it's not even supposed to work ATM  
13:12 <vmassol> that's why it has a manual trigger  
13:13 <+sburjan> I am trying to run the script ludovic provided,on http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XCOMMONS-234  but I get an error  
13:13 <+sburjan> Script12.groovy: 14: Ambiguous expression could be a parameterless closure expression, an isolated open code block, or it may continue a previous statement;  
13:13 <+sburjan>    solution: Add an explicit parameter list, e.g. {it -> ...}, or force it to be treated as an open block by giving it a label, e.g. L:{...}, and also either remove the previous newline, or add an explicit semicolon ';' @ line 14, column 1.  
13:13 <+sburjan>    {{groovy}}  
13:14 <+sburjan> and I can't figure out what am i doing wrong  
13:14 <vmassol> works fine  
13:15 <vmassol> just tested it  
13:15 <vmassol> as is with no change  
13:15 <vmassol> :)  
13:15 <+sburjan> didn't you had to put {{groovy}} to surround the script ?  
13:15 <vmassol> of course as it's written in the issue  
13:15 <vmassol> I copied exactly as is  
13:16 <+sburjan> well in the issue I don't see the {{ and }} :)  
13:16 <vmassol> look again  
13:16 <vmassol> :)  
13:16 <+sburjan> I am. realy  
13:17 <+sburjan> \*realy  
13:17 <vmassol> refresh  
13:17 <+sburjan> yes, works now. Thanks !  
13:18 <vmassol> I didn't change the issue btw  
13:18 <vmassol> just put the missing code and noformat macros  
13:18 <vmassol> so that it displays nicer  
13:39 <eshan> has quit  
13:56 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:12 <cjd> has quit  
14:50 <sburjan> has quit  
15:03 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
15:10 <vmassol> jvdrean: make sure to add an info box explaining that the icon field is new in 4.2M3 and linking to the documentation about the application panel to explain that apps created by AWM are automatically "registered" starting with 4.2M3  
15:12 <vmassol> jvdrean: you need to improve http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Panels+Application to list existing panels in this app too and document your new application panel  
15:37 <DSpair\_AFK> is now known as <D-Spair>  
15:37 <D-Spair> is now known as <DSpair\_AFK>  
15:48 <vmassol> jvdrean: a read arrow on http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/App+Within+Minutes+Application/AppWithinMinutes-PanelEntry.png would have been nice :) yeah I know… we want perfection right? ;)  
15:51 <vmassol> jvdrean: thanks :)  
15:51 <+jvdrean> vmassol: thanks skitch for keeping the screenshots history  
15:51 <vmassol> hehe  
15:54 <vmassol> jvdrean: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7927# is not complete, it's missing documentation  
15:55 <vmassol> hmm seems the filter here is not working well since XWIKI-7927 is not listed: http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?mode=hide&requestId=11594  
15:55 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&jqlQuery=Project+in+%28%22XWiki+Commons%22%2C+%22XWiki+Rendering%22%2C+%22XWiki+Platform%22%2C+%22XWiki+Enterprise%22%2C+%22XWiki+Enterprise+Manager%22%29+and+fixVersion+in+%28%224.1-milestone-2%22%2C+%224.1-rc-1%22%29+and+resolution+in+%28%22Fixed%22%29+and+%28%28Documentation+is+EMPTY%29+or+%28%22Documentation+in+Release+Notes%22+is+EMPTY%29%29  
16:15 <Enygma`> building the release...  
16:19 <vmassol> yeah  
16:20 <vmassol> all tests are passing?  
16:21 <vmassol> I see 3 functional tests modules in yellow: extension, selenium, wysiwyg  
16:33 <Enygma`> yes, extension is failing because it ran last time on an agent with the display issue, but it is passing fine on a good agent (agent-1 for example)  
16:34 <Enygma`> selenium is a flicker according to mflorea  
16:35 <Enygma`> and wysiwyg is a missing font issue on the agent, which is more of a build/environment problem again  
16:35 <Enygma`> so all the current problems should be accounted for  
16:36 <vmassol> Enygma`: ok. Good enough for the release then. We should still look at fixing those issues ofc  
17:32 <vmassol> hmm guys shouldn't we also publish our releases on dzone?  
17:33 <vmassol> (our release announcements)  
17:33 <vmassol> I've just seen that GateIn 3.4 has been announced there: http://www.dzone.com/links/gatein\_34\_is\_released.html  
17:33 <vmassol> I'll send a vote since I think that's a good idea

20:14 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
20:17 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
21:02 <vmassol> has quit  
21:40 <Denis> has quit  
21:51 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
22:00 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
22:11 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
22:18 <vmassol> has quit  
22:34 <jlamoree> has joined #xwiki  
22:41 <jlamoree> I have an issue with XWiki Enterprise 4.1.4 where the WYSIWYG editor just shows a spinner image, rather than the content. I'm having trouble looking in JIRA to see if it's a known issue  
22:41 <jlamoree> This is an upgrade from XWiki 3.2, if memory serves  
22:41 <jlamoree> I thought it might be related to the locking mechanism -- the return from the Ajax call is 204 - No content  
22:42 <jlamoree> But I don't know if that's by design  
22:42 <jlamoree> I've tried different browsers on different platforms  
22:43 <jlamoree> The simple WIki editor works fine for making changes  
22:44 <jlamoree> I installed the XWiki Enterprise UI pages XAR for 4.1.4 and remove the same item from the old version  
22:44 <jlamoree> What I haven't done yet is create a new database and import everything to it. I don't know if that's necessary or recommended.  
22:45 <jlamoree> I don't see any JavaScript errors in the console or 404's in the request log  
22:46 <jlamoree> This is running in Tomcat 7.0.30 container. I tried with/without the native Tomcat library.  
22:47 <jlamoree> Nothing especially interesting shows up in the Catalina logs  
22:52 <jlamoree> I do see that the IFRAME is loaded with the content to be edited. And if I delete the div.loading that obscures it, I can start typing into that area.  
22:53 <jlamoree> However, div.xRichTextEditor div.gwt-MenuBar is empty, but for the full-screen button.  
22:59 <mflorea> has quit  
23:34 <jlamoree> Well, I installed a standalone copy on my workstation. The WYSIWYG editor works just fine. And I see that the site looks much different. There must be an issue with my upgrade process.  
23:48 <Denis> has quit  
23:51 <jlamoree> I found the problem. Turns out, I didn't do the XWiki Enterprise UI pages XAR for 4.1.4 import correctly.  
23:51 <jlamoree> Now it's running like a top.
